topic: The Journalists and Journalism that Have Shaped Am

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
This course will focus on the work of iconic American journalists?from Ben Franklin to Nellie Bly to Ida B. Wells to Edward R. Murrow to Tom Wolfe?that all journalism students needs to be aware of; students will read and view inspiring U.S. journalism masterpieces from the 1700s to the 2000s. The works studied will address such topics as: American independence; lynching and the KKK; McCarthyism; World War II and the Vietnam War; Watergate; the role of the Indigenous and ethnic media; civil rights, women's right and gay rights; protection of the environment. Selected short works?for example, Thomas Paine's Common Sense and John Hersey's Hiroshima?will be read in their entirety. During each class students will be invited to dissect and react to important works of American journalism. There will be no exams, just one final paper.

Estimated cost of books is $64 (based on Amazon): Judith Serrin, Muckraking! The Journalism That Changed America (paperback, $25.00); Ida B. Wells, On Lynching (Humanity Books paperback, $19.99), John Hersey,

Hiroshima (paperback, $7.95); James Agee and Walker Evans, Let Us Now Praise Famous Men (paperback, $10.88).
